page.title: 08A Small Museum in Halstead
page.content: Opposite our school is a{small {museum}and we went to it because this year is the fortieth anniversary of V.E. day. We saw a First World War engine from a{Beardmore fighter.}Then we saw a fire bomb which hit the ground and started a fire.{In Halstead {four V1 flying bombs and one V2 {exploded.}We were also shown an Air Raid Warden's hat. The owner of the exhibits started his hobby when he was a child.A plane crashed and he went out and collected the pieces. We were told that on the {14th of March 1944, 1240 fire bombs {were dropped on Station Road,}and we saw a chart with the bombs marked on it. Halstead Place used to be a German Prisoner of War camp. At the end of our visit we were allowed to go in the {gun turret of a Whitley bomber.
